thread.title: Video: Grossest defensive tactic you’ll see all year
thread.title_full: Video: Grossest defensive tactic you’ll see all year

title: Video: Grossest defensive tactic you’ll see all year
text:
Liverpool v Plymouth FA Cup video: Emre Can receives unique defensive atention from Sonny Bradley Caitlin Murray, Fox Sports US, FOX SPORTS January 9, 2017 2:48pm 
WHEN Plymouth Argyle held Liverpool to a scoreless draw on Monday morning, it was a big result for the small fourth-division side that came from relentless defending. 
It wasn’t pretty – Plymouth barely had the ball and were happy to sit back the entire time – and the end justified the means for the League Two side. 
But the means included some unorthodox defending methods, including giving out what looked like “wet willies.” 
WATCH THE BIZARRE DEFENDING TECHNIQUES IN THE VIDEO ABOVE 
That is Plymouth defender Sonny Bradley pinching the armpits of Liverpool midfielder Emre Can, and then following it up with a finger in the ear. 
We don’t know whether or not his finger was dry or if it was officially a wet willy (perhaps Can’s sweat did the job), but it looks rather unpleasant either way. media_camera Sonny Bradley sticks his finger in Emre Can’s ear. 
Unsurprisingly, Can was not happy with the pest on Plymouth’s side and appealed for referees to be on the lookout for the unsporting tactics. Credit to Can though – a less disciplined player might have turned around and given something back to Bradley, risking a red card. 
Now, the two sides must meet again for a replay next week to decide who advances in the FA Cup, and referees might want to be on high alert for armpit pinches and wet (or dry) willies.
